chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Ray Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty. Sentence is withheld, DE placed on 5 years probation consecutive to 15CF280.  Conditions of probation:  $906 fine/costs,    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge which is included in fine.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.    Absolute Sobriety.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent including cognitive thinking programming.
Counts #2 through #5 are dismissed but read in.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  
DE pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty. Sentence is withheld, DE placed on 5 years probation consecutive to 15CF280.  Conditions of probation:  $906 fine/costs,    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge which is included in fine.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.    Absolute Sobriety.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent including cognitive thinking programming.
Counts #2 through #5 are dismissed but read in.

Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer. Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconson.
Atty Moldenhauer acknowledges receipt of Information.  DE is advised of rights.  DE stands mute- Not Guilty pleas are entered.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Moldenhauer waived prelim.  Court advised DE as to his rights to a preliminary exam.  DE does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds DE has freely waived his right to a prelim.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Bond will continue.  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.    DEF stands mute, court enters NG Plea on all counts.  DEF wants preliminary hearing within time limits.   Bond Continues.    Traffic Tracking  16TR228,16TR229,15TR230,16TR231  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in court with attorney Martin Jarvis (Special Appearance).  Defendant Travis Ray Ladwig in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Following open discussion in court between DEF and Attny Martin Jarvis, DEF agrees to move intial appearance to next Tuesday.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
2/26/2016 - Revised Judgment  & Cover Letter from Attny Daniel Freund
Defendant appeared in custody via video.  State appeared by Aaron Marcoux.  Probable cause found -  Cash bail set at $25000.00
